byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Former top military commander and Central Intelligence Agency director David H Petraeus, testifying before Senate Armed Services Committee, scores military's strategies for fighting Islamic State in Syria; recommends that United States set up safe havens in Syria for moderate rebels fighting Islamic State and advocates stronger military pressure against Assad government, aimed at leveraging a political solution to crisis.
lead_paragraph: In his first testimony since resigning as director of the C.I.A., Mr. Petraeus told Congress that the United States should act to stop the Syrian government’s barrel-bomb attacks.

headline.main: David Petraeus Urges Stronger U.S. Military Effort in Syria
headline.print_headline: Former U.S. Commander Sharply Criticizes Syria Policy

snippet: In his first testimony since resigning as director of the C.I.A., Mr. Petraeus told Congress that the United States should act to stop the Syrian government’s barrel-bomb attacks.
